bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 44 (Tuesday, March 12, 2019)][House][Pages H2680-H2681]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. McCOLLUM:H.R. 1695.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:[[Page H2681]]Article 1, Section 8 of the Constitution

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

item.name: Department of Health and Human Services
Social work, volunteer service, charitable organizations

summary.text:
Community Services Block Grant Reauthorization Act of 2019

This bill reauthorizes the Community Services Block Grant program through FY2028 and makes other changes to the program, including with respect to administration and leadership; performance measurement; and minimum and maximum allotments to states and territories.

bill.title: Community Services Block Grant Reauthorization Act of 2019

item.title: Community Services Block Grant Reauthorization Act of 2019
To amend the Community Services Block Grant Act to reauthorize and modernize the Act.
Community Services Block Grant Reauthorization Act of 2019

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
